metadata.title: CVE-2019-11718 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Activity Stream can display content from sent from the Snippet Servicewebsite. This content is written to innerHTML on the Activity Stream pagewithout sanitization, allowing for a potential access to other informationavailable to the Activity Stream, such as browsing history, if the SnipperService were compromised. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
